citation.case_name: Connecticut Ex Rel. New York & New England R. Co. v. Woodruff

html:
153 U.S. 689

14 S.Ct. 976

38 L.Ed. 869

STATE OF CONNECTICUT ex rel. NEW YORK & N. E. R. CO. et al.
v.
WOODRUFF et al.

No. 958.

May 14, 1894.

1

[Statement of Case from pages 690-691 intentionally omitted]

2

Henry C. Robinson, for motion.

3

Tilton E. Doolittle, opposed.

4

Mr. Chief Justice of FULLER.

5

The motion to dismiss is sustained. Woodruff v. Railroad Co., 59 Conn. 63, 20 Atl. 17; State v. Asylum St. Bridge Commission, 63 Conn. 91, 26 Atl. 580; Railroad Co. v. Woodruff, 140 U. S. 691, 11 Sup. Ct. 1025; New York & N. E. R. Co. v. Town of Bristol, 151 U. S. 556, 14 Sup. Ct. 437; Insurance Co. v. Treasurer, 11 Wall 204; Navigation Co. v. Reybold, 142 U. S. 643, 12 Sup. Ct. 290; Hammond v. Johnston, 142 U. S. 73, 12 Sup. Ct. 141; City of New Orleans v. New Orleans Waterworks Co., 142 U. S. 79, 12 Sup. Ct. 142; Railroad Co. v. Hopkins, 130 U. S. 210, 9 Sup. Ct. 503.
html_lawbox:
153 U.S. 689 (1894)

CONNECTICUT ex rel. NEW YORK & NEW ENGLAND RAILROAD COMPANY
v.
WOODRUFF.

No. 958.

Supreme Court of United States.

Submitted April 30, 1894.
Decided May 14, 1894.
ERROR TO THE SUPREME COURT OF ERRORS OF THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT.

*691 Mr. Henry C. Robinson for the motion.

Mr. Tilton E. Doolittle opposing.

The CHIEF JUSTICE: The motion to dismiss is sustained. Woodruff v. Railroad Company, 59 Connecticut, 63; Railroad Company v. Woodruff, 63 Connecticut, 91; Railroad Company v. Woodruff, 140 U.S. 691; Railroad Company v. Bristol, 151 U.S. 556; Insurance Company v. The Treasurer, 11 Wall. 204; Delaware Navigation Co. v. Reybold, 142 U.S. 643; Hammond v. Johnston, 142 U.S. 73; New Orleans v. N.O. Water Works Co., 142 U.S. 79; Balt. & Potomac Railroad v. Hopkins, 130 U.S. 210.
